name: Life Goes On: Done to Death
description: A comical puzzle platformer where you must die to progress. The bodies you leave behind are your only tools to solve puzzles on your quest to find the Cup of Life.
minimum_requirements: Минимальные: ОС: Windows Vista or later Процессор: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz Оперативная память: 2 GB ОЗУ Видеокарта: Shader Model 3.0 support with 512MB Integrated Memory DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 1100 MB
recommended_requirements: Рекомендованные: ОС: Windows 7 or later Процессор: Intel i3 3.3GHz or better Оперативная память: 4 GB ОЗУ Видеокарта: Shader Model 3.0 Support and 1GB Dedicated Memory DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 1100 MB

reviews.review_text: Very charming and clever, amazing soundtrack. Recommended to anyone.

It's a pretty fun puzzle platformer. I'd call it medium difficulty -- usually the solution becomes obvious within a few minutes, although 'executing' it could take a few (... dozen ...) tries. I've never gotten completely stuck so far (currently on the 4th area or so) so the game only occasionally gets frustrating if you're just playing through and not focusing on the time/death challenges -- although I always try to do the Jeff challenge.

oh my god your amazing. you actually have made an expansion pack instead of a DLC or some other pay to play BS thank you so much. i also like the game its fun and a great all around game.  (i didn't get this for free and i got a coupon but i would definatly pay $12 for it yes i really do like it that much.) also remindes me of Rouge Legacy so if you like that game you'll love this

I first discovered this game at Pax Prime 2014 when it was featured in the Pax 10. The graphics are stunning, the concept is hilarious (and slightly morbid), and I love the variety and challenges that this puzzle game presents. I cannot wait for my knight plushie...Take this as a hint developers and merchandise, I will buy all the things :) I would recommend it to anyone looking for an enjoyable, challenging, and casually paced gane :)
LGO is a lot of fun. Support Indie Games!

An excellent puzzle game! The main levels should only take several hours to beat, but attempting the fastest time possible on each will leave you likely ripping your hair out at how nimble you must be. For its release price of under $10, I would definitely recommend it.

Taking the rules of death in gaming to a completely different place, this game is devilishly fun. The graphics and physics of this puzzle game are very well done for this independent company based in Edmonton, AB. Well worth the time and money.
'This is f****** awesome'
Fun and clever puzzles, a great overall tone, but a rather lackluster asthetic. I enjoyed it immensely and would recommend it to any puzzle platformer enthusiast.

Great game where you have to think a head and use wisely knights. In the game few levels can give hat or weapon. The idea of using a corpse to promote among the puzzles of the original. Go for the Cup of Life. Отличная игра где вам предстоит думать головой и использовать с умом рыцарей. В игре по прохождению уровня могут дать шапку или оружие. Идея использования трупа для продвижения среди головоломок оригинальная. Вперед за Чашей Жизни.

Unique puzzle platformer that requires you to use your character as stepping stones to complete the puzzles. My favorite part is feeding the fuzzy monster, and in fact didnt realize until much later that you can just toss him a dead body and he will eat it!! This game however needs further content, and some of the puzzles are a bit easy. I hit the developer up on Reddit and asked if we could get a tool to create our own puzzles, but unfortunately that is not going to be likely because of the development path they chose, but man what a perfect platform to release user maps or whatever. All in all, good fun game, and its good for a nice casual play session.

I bought this because it was cheap and looked like a good game for when I'm in the mood to play something more casual. I was surprised by how fun this game got with each new level and each new mechanic. The gameplay is very addictive and simple yet tons of fun and thoughtful.The pacing is great as each level offers carefully constructed puzzles that feel fresh rather then copied or repeated. As you get used to encountering a trap or puzzle mechanic the game adds new layers to keep you thinking!  l*] The game is plain fun. Not a single complaint about it. The gameplay is solid and feels rewarding as you solve silly puzzles by sacrificing your oddly named loyal knights.     The audio is pleasant, no annoying soundtrack or repetitive horrible sound effects that drive you insane.     The visual style and graphics suit the game completely and are quite delightful.      Appeals to casual gamers as well as those looking for a challenge as each level can be replayed with several objectives to try and accomplish including finding secrets, beating a level with the fewest 'lives' sacrificed and speed running. Completing all challenges for each level and earning the highest score/award can be quite challenging even for a hardcore gamer- but these objectives are all optional and are NOT required to continue to the next level.      The length of the game so far is quite a bit more then I originally expected. After 3 hours I don't think I'm even at the half way point yet- I might be nowhere near it!     In my 3 hours I've expirienced no stutter, long loading times, bugs, glitches or any annoyances. The game has run quickly and smoothly throughout, and I'm playing it at it's highest settings on a fairly cheap laptop that can't run AAA games.  I would recommend this game to anyone who wants a game that can be played in short bursts or longer sessions, anyone looking for something non-serious and affordable.

I personally like this game. It makes you use your problem solving abilities as well as making it fun and a bit goofy. My favorite is that each knight is given a name and a lot of times they're very silly names

Soooooo much fun! Great puzzler, and hilarious concept: you have to kill yourself (often multiple times) to finish the level. Definitely is replayable because there are achievements for getting the levels done fast, with few deaths and/or getting eaten by an adorable critter on every level. Even the credits are themselves a level with achievements. Seriously well-crafted game.
Fun game with an interesting concept.
Got the Milecide Achievement, but life goes on!
Amazing soundtrack And overall just a really enjoyable puzzle game with KNIGHTS!.

I played the demo and it looked fun and promising. However, I'm sad to say that the entire game is the same as the demo. just grind through levels. I was hoping for something a little more silly or fun but did not get that. I'd recommend it if you like that kind of stuff, but I just don't like games that work better as an ipod game. I was expecting more than that.

This game is like a nice mix between Portal 2 and Braid, however without portals and time-traveling for sure, but with dying as a mechanic (you have to die at least once in a level). The game gets harder the further you come, and there are multiple solutions, hidden stuff and shortcuts everyhwere and you get rewarded for being smart and thoughtfull. The humor in the game is actually quite minimal and most of it only there at the very end. Also it has a pretty good soundtrack, which sometimes reminded me to Donkey Kong Country Returns and Tropical Freeze, some songs are just epic. Beating levels as fast as you can or with less deaths are good replay values.
Well worth the asking price. Alot of fun throughout the entire game. Download the demo and see for yourself no strings attached.

This game is so much fun. It is a unique twist on classic platform puzzle games. It is very fun to play and pure comedy.   10/10 solid gameplay that will keep you trying for the best scores and times. It is very hard to put down.  The music is a lot of fun and the gameplay is terrific. The puzzles can be quite difficult or easy it just depends but nothing ever seems impossible. This is up there on my favorite game list right now.  I highly suggest you pick this up today!  It is very addicting though!

Very fun and relaxing platformer, I recommend it to anyone bored and looking for something chill to do. If the death gimmick disturbs you, I recommend playing LISA first as that will numb your morals for a limited time.

If you are looking in to whether or not to buy this game, I think you should. It's a really cool puzzle/platformer with an awesome uniue mechanic. That mechanic is that when you die, your body lingers around, and it is used to do things like act as a stepladder, let you climb where there are spikes, and hold down buttons for you. Sometimes I find that I can get a bit frustrated with the puzzles, but I found out that if you just leave it for ten minutes or so and come back to it, that usually solves the problem. This game is a fun, casual pickup I would certainly reccomend.
